jobs.title: SDR Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
At Pylon, we're building the future of B2B Post Sales.

Top support and success teams at companies like Hightouch, Merge, and Sardine use Pylon to manage their customer support and customer success.

We’re building an all-in-one support platform powered by conversational data and layered with intelligence to help our customers run their operations in real-time. We’re backed by YCombinator, General Catalyst, and a16z and have over 500 B2B companies trusting Pylon to power their customer support and success.

Our GTM tech stack includes tools like Salesforce, Amplemarket, Clay, Default, Pylon, and Equals.

What You’ll Do 📌

  • First, build the process. Although this role will turn into a manager position where you build out a team, we expect you to first be able to do the job yourself so you can teach others.

  • Pipeline Building: Purely outbound. You will book meetings for all of our AEs, no 1:1 pairing for now.

  • Prospecting: Research target accounts and create account lists that you will outbound (150-1000 employees).

  • Qualify Leads: You won’t be qualifying leads over calls or running discovery. We expect you to outbound to companies that are a fit. No BANT over here.

  • Book Meetings: It’s not super vital how you book meetings. LinkedIn, Cold-calling, email, smoke signal, doesn’t matter. We do expect a well rounded individual that has the ability to book across multiple channels.

  • Collaboration: You will work with the AE team on messaging, feedback, etc. but this is not a hand holding position. You will also work with our founder who leads all GTM.

  • Build from Scratch: We have basic playbooks, messaging, and sequences that work. But we want you to build what you know works or develop new strategies. The world is literally yours: SFDC is clean and open (no torched accounts), companies are fed up with the status quo, and customers love us.

Who You Are 💼

  • 1+ years as an SDR manager selling SaaS; required.

  • Past quota hitter. Your motivation should not just be to hit your number but also crush it.

  • You’re agile. This attribute isn’t required to book a meeting but it is required to keep someone on the phone. If you can think on your feet and have the right responses (not just phone) at the right time, we want you.

  • You’re fast. You don’t need to be a Pylon expert overnight but we are looking for someone who can understand the problem we are solving quickly.

  • Experienced with a sales stack (SFDC, Amplemarket (or any other engagement tool), etc.)

More about Pylon

Traction: Have hundreds of paying customers and are growing fast

Funding: In addition to investment from Y Combinator and General Catalyst, a16z we just announced our Series B ($51M total raised)

Founders: Advith Chelikani, Robert Eng, and Marty Kausas

Team: Currently 55+ and growing!

jobs.title: Product Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
At Pylon, we're building the future of B2B Post Sales.

Top support and success teams at companies like Hightouch, Merge, and Sardine use Pylon to manage their customer support and customer success.

We’re building an all-in-one support platform powered by conversational data and layered with intelligence to help our customers run their operations in real-time. We’re backed by YCombinator, General Catalyst, and a16z and have over 780 B2B companies trusting Pylon to power their customer support and success.

Until now, product decisions have been founder-led. We were able to move very quickly while maintaining high context across both customers and our internal team. That said, product scope has increased quickly. We now sell a support platform, AI products, and account management tool; each one of these surface areas go deep and have single companies built around them.

There has become a clear need for more dedicated product-thinking in the company, so we are looking for our first Product Manager to join the team in-person.

What you'll do

  • Be our first PM.

  • We are a compound startup. We don’t need you to own a single product, we need you to own a product area.

  • Deeply live and breathe a single customer persona. Do whatever it takes to serve that one type of customer.

  • Drive a business outcome (i.e. $XX ARR or XX enterprise customers). Sub-OKRs around usage are fine but not your main OKR.

  • Span across PDE to GTM. Work closely with engineering and design to ship products while also working with PMM and AEs to figure out the right marketing angle and pain points to sell on. Nothing is beyond your purview to push it to completion.

  • Talk to customers every day.

  • Ideally B2B experience lifting something from 0 → 1.

  • We’re NOT looking for a project manager.

  • We resolve decisions by arguing it out. Be able to voice your opinion and argue with us. Take all the arguments and translate them into a conclusion.

Requirements

  • Located in (or will relocate to) San Francisco and excited about working in-person

  • Very organized and hard working and fast

  • At least a few years of experience

jobs.title: Head of Marketing
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Pylon

Pylon is the AI-Native Support Platform for B2B companies. We consolidate ticketing, account management, knowledge base, AI agents, analytics, and chat into one product. Over 700 customers use Pylon to run their post-sales motion. We’re Series B, well-funded, and growing pipeline 15% MoM.

We’re looking for a Head of Marketing who can own our growth engine end-to-end — driving demand, shaping pipeline, and building a function that scales. This is a hands-on role: you’ll experiment, execute, and build the team around what works.

What You’ll Do

  • Own pipeline generation as the #1 marketing KPI

  • Design and run multi-channel demand programs (LinkedIn/Google ads, events, content, outbound, etc.)

  • Build and scale campaigns that convert top-of-funnel awareness into opportunities

  • Partner with Sales to set clear lead → pipeline → revenue targets and deliver against them

  • Define and track marketing ROI across channels, doubling down on what works

  • Oversee brand, launches, and messaging with a growth lens (every activity should tie back to pipeline)

  • Hire, coach, and scale the marketing team (growth, product marketing, content, design)

What You’ve Done

  • 6+ years in B2B SaaS marketing with direct ownership of pipeline goals

  • Proven track record running multi-channel demand gen (paid, organic, events, partnerships)

  • Built or scaled a marketing team at a fast-growing startup (Series A–C preferred)

  • Strong analytical mindset — comfortable with Salesforce, attribution, funnel reporting

  • Hands-on: able to execute campaigns directly, not just manage vendors

  • Excellent storytelling and positioning skills; know how to craft simple, clear narratives that convert

Why Join Pylon

  • Be the first marketing leader at a high-growth startup

  • Work directly with founders on go-to-market strategy

  • Join a strong in-person culture in San Francisco (we run like a sports team)

  • Comp package includes competitive salary, equity, and benefits

At Pylon, we're building the future of B2B Post Sales.

Top support and success teams at companies like Hightouch, Merge, and Sardine use Pylon to manage their customer support and customer success.

We’re building an all-in-one support platform powered by conversational data and layered with intelligence to help our customers run their operations in real-time. We’re backed by YCombinator, General Catalyst, and a16z and have over 500 B2B companies trusting Pylon to power their customer support and success.

Our GTM tech stack includes tools like Salesforce, Amplemarket, Clay, Default, Pylon, and Equals.

What You’ll Do 📌

  • Pipeline Building: Purely outbound. You will book meetings for all of our AEs, no 1:1 pairing for now.

  • Prospecting: Research target accounts and create account lists that you will outbound (150-1000 employees).

  • Qualify Leads: You won’t be qualifying leads over calls or running discovery. We expect you to outbound to companies that are a fit. No BANT over here.

  • Book Meetings: It’s not super vital how you book meetings. LinkedIn, Cold-calling, email, smoke signal, doesn’t matter. We do expect a well rounded individual that has the ability to book across multiple channels.

  • Collaboration: You will work with the AE team on messaging, feedback, etc. but this is not a hand holding position. You will also work with our founder who leads all GTM.

  • Build from Scratch: We have basic playbooks, messaging, and sequences that work. But we want you to build what you know works or develop new strategies. The world is literally yours: SFDC is clean and open (no torched accounts), companies are fed up with the status quo, and customers love us.

Who You Are 💼

  • 1-2 years of experience in an SDR or BDR role selling SaaS; required.

  • Quota hitter. Your motivation should not just be to hit your number but also crush it.

  • You’re agile. This attribute isn’t required to book a meeting but it is required to keep someone on the phone. If you can think on your feet and have the right responses (not just phone) at the right time, we want you.

  • You’re fast. You don’t need to be a Pylon expert overnight but we are looking for someone who can understand the problem we are solving quickly.

  • Conduct regular search term analysis, negative keyword optimization, and impression share monitoring to maximize budget efficiency

  • Strong analytical skills - data-driven and detail-oriented
